item.title: Networks Containers Jamstack
item.description: Networks State is at the bottom of almost all our problems when it comes to computer systems. Some people would point to concurrency, but concurrency without state is trivial. I’ve been a network admin at a small web host for over a decade. Started with Foundry, did Cisco Cat6500 for far too long, and then switched to Juniper (MX and QFX primarily). When I started I was a hybrid programmer/sysadmin/netadmin because the company was less than 10 people.

item.title: Immutable Annoyance
item.description: So quotes like this annoy me The immutable server pattern: Once code has been committed in Git, we don’t want anything else to change. The GitOps Pipeline - Part 2 the thing is, it oversimplifies. There is some state anytime your code runs. What they mean is immutable is configuration, (by which I mean state that persists between runs). There are, it seems to me, three distinct sources of persistent state.

item.title: FizzBuzz Noodling
item.description:
FizzBuzz

A large percentage of programmers are probably familiar with the FizzBuzz problem. This post was inspired by a solution that sent me contemplating what makes a given piece of code easy or hard to understand.
